Q4 FY25 Results:Marico reported strong performance for the quarter ended March 31, 2025. Consolidated net profit increased 8% year-on-year to ₹343 crore, with revenue from operations up 20% to ₹2,730 crore. The board recommended a final dividend of ₹7 per share for FY25.

Reappointment of MD & CEO:The company announced the re-appointment of Saugata Gupta as Managing Director and CEO for a further period of two years, starting April 1, 2026, until March 31, 2028.

India Business Performance:Marico's India business saw strong volume growth of 7% in Q4 FY25, a 14-quarter high. Nearly 95% of the India portfolio either gained or sustained market share and 80% gained or sustained penetration levels.

International Business Performance:The international business delivered 16% constant currency growth (CCG) in Q4 FY25 and 14% in FY25.

Food Business Growth:The food business, under the Saffola brand, is projected to surpass the edible oil segment within three to four years, with foods exceeding ₹900 crore in FY25. The company aims for 25% growth in this segment, focusing on product expansion like oats, honey, and snacks.

Sustainability Focus:Marico reaffirmed its sustainability vision on Earth Day, targeting 93% clean energy usage by 2030, a threefold increase from 2017 levels.

Analysts' estimates placed Marico's Q4 FY25 net profit around ₹336.7 crore, according to Bloomberg data. The reported profit of ₹343 crore surpassed these estimates.

The company's stock has shown strong performance, gaining 34.74% in the last 12 months and 9.11% year-to-date as of May 2, 2025.

According to Bloomberg data, 31 out of 42 analysts recommend a 'buy' rating for Marico stock, eight suggest 'hold', and three gave a 'sell' rating.

The average 12-month analyst price target implies a potential upside of 5.4%.
